nodes.text: Orbital Assembly Facility 7, also known as CEC orbital 7, was an assembly facility and shipyard operated by the Corellian Engineering Corporation. In 60 BBY, the YT-1300 light freighter with serial number YT 492727ZED, which later became known as the Millennium Falcon, was constructed around a new generation droid brain that was installed in a stock Hanx-Wargel SuperFlow IV computer at the facility.

Orbital Assembly Facility 7 was first mentioned in the new Star Wars canon in the 22nd issue of the De Agostini magazine Star Wars: Build the Millennium Falcon, which was published in 2015. Orbital Assembly Facility 7 was originally introduced in the Star Wars Legends 2008 novel Millennium Falcon, written by James Luceno.
